goals.question: What is the overall trend of unemployment across all industries?
goals.visualization: Line chart showing the trend of unemployment rate over time
goals.rationale: This visualization helps to identify the overall trend of unemployment rate across all industries over time.

goals.question: Which industry has the highest unemployment rate?
goals.visualization: Bar chart showing the unemployment rate for each industry
goals.rationale: This visualization helps to identify the industry with the highest unemployment rate, which can be useful for policymakers and job seekers.

goals.question: What is the relationship between education level and unemployment rate?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot showing the relationship between education level and unemployment rate
goals.rationale: This visualization helps to identify the relationship between education level and unemployment rate, which can be useful for policymakers and educators.

goals.question: What is the distribution of unemployment rate across all industries?
goals.visualization: Histogram showing the distribution of unemployment rate across all industries
goals.rationale: This visualization helps to identify the distribution of unemployment rate across all industries, which can be useful for policymakers and job seekers.

goals.question: What is the unemployment rate for each state?
goals.visualization: Choropleth map showing the unemployment rate for each state
goals.rationale: This visualization helps to identify the unemployment rate for each state, which can be useful for policymakers and job seekers.

code:
```
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['date'], format='%Y-%m-%d', errors='coerce')
    data = data[pd.notna(data['date'])]
    data = data.sort_values(by='date')
    plt.plot(data['date'], data['unemployment_rate'], color='blue')
    plt.xlabel('Year')
    plt.ylabel('Unemployment Rate')
    plt.title('What is the overall trend of unemployment across all industries?')
    return plt

chart = plot(data)
```

```
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data = data.sort_values(by='unemployment_rate', ascending=False)
    fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 6))
    ax.bar(data['industry'], data['unemployment_rate'], color='blue')
    ax.axhline(y=data['unemployment_rate'].max(), color='red', linestyle='--', label=f"Max: {data['unemployment_rate'].max():.2f}")
    ax.set_xlabel('Industry')
    ax.set_ylabel('Unemployment Rate')
    ax.set_title('Which industry has the highest unemployment rate?')
    ax.legend()
    plt.xticks(rotation=90)
    return plt

chart = plot(data)
```

```
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data = data[['Education Level', 'Unemployment Rate']]
    plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
    sns.scatterplot(x='Education Level', y='Unemployment Rate', data=data, hue='Education Level', s=100)
    plt.title('What is the relationship between education level and unemployment rate?', wrap=True)
    plt.xlabel('Education Level')
    plt.ylabel('Unemployment Rate')
    plt.legend(title='Education Level', loc='upper left', bbox_to_anchor=(1, 1))
    return plt

chart = plot(data)
```

```
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    sns.histplot(data=data, x='unemployment_rate', kde=True, color='blue')
    plt.axvline(data['unemployment_rate'].mean(), color='red', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=1, label=f"Mean: {data['unemployment_rate'].mean():.2f}")
    plt.axvline(data['unemployment_rate'].median(), color='green', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=1, label=f"Median: {data['unemployment_rate'].median():.2f}")
    plt.legend()
    plt.xlabel('Unemployment Rate')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of unemployment rate across all industries?')
    return plt

chart = plot(data)
```

```
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
import json
import urllib.request
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.colors as mcolors
import matplotlib.cm as cm

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    with urllib.request.urlopen("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/vega/vega-datasets/master/data/unemployment-across-industries.json") as url:
        data = json.loads(url.read().decode())
    data = pd.DataFrame(data)
    data = data.pivot(index='date', columns='series', values='value')
    data.index = pd.to_datetime(data.index)
    data = data.resample('M').mean()
    data = data.reset_index()
    data['date'] = data['date'].dt.strftime('%Y-%m')
    data = data.melt(id_vars=['date'], var_name='state', value_name='unemployment_rate')
    data = data.sort_values(by=['date', 'state'])
    data['unemployment_rate'] = data['unemployment_rate'].astype(float)
    data['state'] = data['state'].str.upper()

    fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(12, 6))
    cmap = cm.get_cmap('Blues')
    norm = mcolors.Normalize(vmin=data['unemployment_rate'].min(), vmax=data['unemployment_rate'].max())
    colors = [cmap(norm(value)) for value in data['unemployment_rate']]
    ax.bar(data['state'], data['unemployment_rate'], color=colors)
    ax.set_xlabel('State')
    ax.set_ylabel('Unemployment Rate')
    ax.set_title('What is the unemployment rate for each state?')
    sm = plt.cm.ScalarMappable(cmap=cmap, norm=norm)
    sm.set_array([])
    cbar = plt.colorbar(sm)
    cbar.set_label('Unemployment Rate')
    plt.xticks(rotation=90)
    plt.tight_layout()

    return plt

chart = plot(None)
plt.show()
```

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
import json
import urllib.request
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.colors as mcolors
import matplotlib.cm as cm

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    with urllib.request.urlopen("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/vega/vega-datasets/master/data/unemployment-across-industries.json") as url:
        data = json.loads(url.read().decode())
    data = pd.DataFrame(data)
    data = data.pivot(index='date', columns='series', values='value')
    data.index = pd.to_datetime(data.index)
    data = data.resample('M').mean()
    data = data.reset_index()
    data['date'] = data['date'].dt.strftime('%Y-%m')
    data = data.melt(id_vars=['date'], var_name='state', value_name='unemployment_rate')
    data = data.sort_values(by=['date', 'state'])
    data['unemployment_rate'] = data['unemployment_rate'].astype(float)
    data['state'] = data['state'].str.upper()

    fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(12, 6))
    cmap = cm.get_cmap('Blues')
    norm = mcolors.Normalize(vmin=data['unemployment_rate'].min(), vmax=data['unemployment_rate'].max())
    colors = [cmap(norm(value)) for value in data['unemployment_rate']]
    ax.bar(data['state'], data['unemployment_rate'], color=colors)
    ax.set_xlabel('State')
    ax.set_ylabel('Unemployment Rate')

    sm.set_array([])
    cbar = plt.colorbar(sm)
    cbar.set_label('Unemployment Rate')
    plt.xticks(rotation=90)
    plt.tight_layout()

    return plt

chart = plot(None)
